member.name: T:Kvasir.Schema.DBValue
member.summary: A thin wrapper around a CLR object that can be stored in a back-end relational database.

remarks.para: The class is intended to provide an abstraction over the generalized CLR for use in contexts where compile-time type information is not available. The advantage to using a in APIs rather than is the guarantee that a only ever wraps an objec that can validly be stored into a database, whereas an could feasibly hold an object of any type. Additionally, the wrapped value is never a reference: a sentinel value is used to indicate , mitigating the need for verbose checks.

The strong typing afforded by CLR enums is lost when the enumerator values are stored in a back-end relational database. Some providers afford value checking, either through an explicit enum data type or via CHECK constraints; however, even in these cases, the actual storage is generally an integer or a string. For this reason, an instance of will never wrap a CLR enumerator: it is the responsibility of the user to convert the CLR object into the corresponding database object, be it an integer or string or other supported type.

The same general logic applies to any transformations applied between the CLR domain and the database domain. The class is intended to exactly wrap the object that is stored, and as such it is the responsibility of the user to apply any necessary transforms prior to creating the object.

Because of the possibility that a instane wraps a sentinel indicating , it is not strictly possible to determine the DBType of a particular instance. To check if a is valid for a Field of a particular DBType, use the applicable query method on the DBType class, which will account for nullability support as well.
